channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rwanda’s Doctors and Nurses Hit Hard by Deadly Marburg Virus
item.description: The Health Ministry has reported that 80 percent of the infected are health care professionals.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel’s Attacks Against Hezbollah Expand
item.description: A strike was reported in the Lebanese city of Tripoli, near the country’s northern edge.

item.title: Vitamin D may improve your energy levels. Here’s how much you need each day
item.description: Here's what to know about vitamin D benefits and risks, particularly when it comes to ending fatigue.

item.title: With ‘SmartLess,’ Jason Bateman, Will Arnett and Sean Hayes Are Building a Media Empire
item.description: Started during the pandemic, this venture is the first step in a media empire being built by the actors Sean Hayes, Will Arnett and Jason Bateman.

item.title: An $803-billion company most people have never heard of just knocked Tesla out of the Magnificent 7
item.description: Broadcom has flown under the radar for years, but it's about to become a household name.

item.title: Michigan Father Dies in Israeli Airstrike in Lebanon, Family Says
item.description: Kamel Ahmad Jawad, a U.S. citizen, was remembered by friends and relatives as someone who chose to stay behind to help others who couldn’t flee.

item.title: Ever-Shrinking Condos Are the Choice of Investors in Toronto and Vancouver
item.description: A new report shows that small condo units are preferred by investors and that a lack of investor buyers may now be delaying new buildings.

item.title: Gen X was supposed to be the economy’s safety net—now they’re the ‘struggling middle child’ balancing retirement and paying for adult children
item.description: "I am much more keenly aware of what's being saved and what's going out now than I ever have at any other point in my life."

item.title: Here’s how to delete your data from 23andMe if you’re worried about protecting your personal health information
item.description: 23andMe has recently come under fire. What does that mean for its 15 million customers?

item.title: 30 Days Out, the Harris and Trump Campaigns Brace for ‘Trench Warfare’
item.description: With tight contests in all seven battleground states, the candidates are pressing for a few thousand votes that could sway the outcome of the entire e...

item.title: Are low-cost airlines over? How Ryanair, EasyJet and Wizz Air are unlocking more profits, and teaching the American giants new tricks
item.description: Today, budget airlines are looking to expand further, but the way they operate differs wildly on either side of the Atlantic, seeking new revenue stre...

item.title: ‘Why Us?’: A Tide of Grief in Lebanon
item.description: Mourners reeled over lost loved ones after an Israeli strike on an apartment building killed at least 45 people.

item.title: Is Gender the Most Important Issue in the Trump-Harris Election?
item.description: Harris could be the first female president. But it’s Trump and Vance who are playing the gender card.

item.title: Francis Ford Coppola’s “Megalopolis” Is a Different Kind of Flop
item.description: Plenty of movies bomb, but Francis Ford Coppola’s latest is part of a different class of box office failures.

item.title: Hit by Disaster? How to Get What You Deserve From Insurers or FEMA
item.description: Experts offered plenty of advice about ways to make the disaster-recovery process work. Here’s what to do and what to avoid.
